definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: "Some of the veteran guys were like, "Oh OK, he switched off.
sentences.chinese: “就像老鸟们那样，”哦，他摆脱你了。

sentences.english: There are no good pilots, only old pilots.
This view might strike some longtime users of the Internet as hopelessly naive and ignorant of history.
sentences.chinese: 很多互联网的老鸟可能会觉得这种看法很傻很天真。

sentences.english: The old birds or the fostered young would gain an advantage .
sentences.chinese: 老鸟和被抚育的小鸟，都会得到利益。

sentences.english: Old birds are hard to pluck.
Old birds are not caught with new nests.
Comer nature is not little, I also become the past master that others place says or old bird.
sentences.chinese: 来的人自然不少，我也成为别人所说的高手或老鸟。

definition: experienced person/an old hand at sth
(coll.) sb new to a particular subject/rookie/beginner/newbie
(slang) novice/greenhorn/fool/idiot/abbr. for 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3], pretty boy
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
Please do not be too severe on me!
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
novice/new hand/sb new to a job
